captions.text: If you were one of those

people on the lunatic fringe that
thought the normal 911 S
wasn't enough you were going to wait for the GT3 that this was the one

to wait for. You were right this was
the one worth waiting for.

We have high expectations when it
comes to the GT3

after all this is the 911 for that
crazed driving enthusiast fringe.
That thinks other 911s aren't enough

if you're in that group you'll be
excited to hear that this GT3 has
a monstrous 9000 rpm redline
but then you might be disappointed to learn this car doesn't come with a
clutch pedal.
On top of that it has a break actuated, faux torque vectoring system,

four-wheel steering system, and active
engine mounts that can soften things up
for when you're commuting.
But don't mistake the GT3 for having gone soft
the 3.8 liter flat six makes 475

horsepower it'll make a claimed 195 miles
an hour.

It's optional carbon ceramic rotors are
sixteen point one inches in diameter
up front and are capped at

six piston calipers and its Michelin
Pilot Sport cup 2's are extremely
grippy.

For good measure the rear wheels are
a foot wide each.
The body is wider and lower

donning more aggressive enlarged air
inlets and bends and not to mention a bigger
wing too.
The look is unmistakably 911

still suave and somewhat refine but
with decidedly more aggression.
I've been waiting for so long
to drive a 911 GT3 and in that time

my anticipation has been building my
expectations getting bigger and

bigger and now that I'm finally behind
the wheel of one
I can happily report it has met everything and it
everything I wanted it to be.
Listen to that.
That wasn't even a red line
like the 911 GT3 is without a doubt on
amazing, amazing,
amazing driving car.

And that's what we expect from the GT3
name you expect extreme amounts of

performance, but also makes satisfaction
from behind the wheel

and the car delivers that. Now we know
we have this

super high revving monstrous flat six
that makes this
terrific sound in the last 500 rpm of its power band.
What I'm also finding is that

it's a pretty broad power band too. Pick
up the throttle at 5000 rpm and
it
accelerates really nicely in the corners.
What I love about naturally aspirated engines is the linearity
through
and to red line. It feels just great.
The shift happened so fast in fact when you

see the tach move you almost can't
believe it you're anticipating
a longer shift but it's not just
the speed it's the control and I'm really is what the gt3 is all about it the supreme body
control in the car.

When you find yourself on a curvy road
that has a few bombs

you don't want a lot of movement with
the car bouncing around
to feel planted and precise and controllable.
A lot of cars with really firm suspension that's what kinda
hangs them up.
This thing on this road which is
fairly bumpy not extremely bumpy

harm always feels like it troll tires
always feel like

there firmly planted on the ground. It's
really satisfying this car to find
series of corners like a long canyon and steer through them while
adding power.
Because the power of the car

and control of the car allows you
to do that.
Being a rear engine car with
all the drivetrain happening back there we have a very light front end
Also a very visible front
that's one thing people won't talk about.

When you have a wrench in the rear you
don't need a lot of Munich homeland

that means you have better forward
visibility anything

which enables you to see more of the
road.
And drive more clearly. The front end just feels so eager to turn and the rear of the car

follows in so nicely car
doesn't feel like it's gonna push
doesn't feel like it's been almost here
balance
I love it.
Launching the GT3 couldn't be simpler
mash both pedals

and just release the brake, the
resulting acceleration is mighty
impressive.
Naturally aspirated 175 our car

that just wants to go around corners fast.
Sixty miles an hour
takes just 3.1
seconds and the quarter mile pass is done in eleven-point three seconds at 122.9
miles an hour.

Those very sticky Michelin Cup two tires
and optional carbon ceramic
rotors work extremely well halting a GT3

from 60 in just ninety eight feet. The
GT3 posted a 22-point
eight-second lap around the figure 8 making it tied for third
fastest around this track.

It's also the only car that makes less
500 horsepower

in the 22 second range. That's a massive
accomplishment and we know there's more
time in the car.

In the suspension setup even as is
average lateral acceleration
was 1.11 G.
This is my first attempt at the new GT3 I've driven all the variations.

It's really interesting watching
evolution as they get
bigger, faster
more sophisticated. HIgher red lines.
The red line on this GT3 is 9000 rpm.
That's insane.
Chanel into turn 8 here at Willow Springs
it's very rough but the 911 does
her job absorbing the bumps
without our end.
145 miles an hour into
turn 1.
Into the carbon brakes they take a fair amount of effort.
They get better as we warm the tires.
The turning on this 911 is so accurate
could be the best
I ever felt.
Low corner tighten the line.
Yeah see the steering response

the rear will let go a little into the corner
that's true.

It's alive our 911 still has a lot of
personality.
Lotta race car in the street 911 GT3.
It is very much a race car for the street.
The GT3 makes the experience of driving fun

and rewarding it sounds tremendous and
feels terrific while reading

9000 rpm over and over again the
acceleration response
are simply addicting.
The chassis provides the driver an immediate sense of accomplishment but it doesn't feel

dumbed-down the car feels constantly
encouraging.

Its numerous electronic aids and
adaptive devices make the GT3 a nice drive
normally,
but they hide in the handling fun.
The completely adjustable suspension and adjustable wing
means you can tailor the driving experience to match track to your
taste or both. These things make you want to explain the people that the GT3
has members

that it's all about the experience, but
then you take a look at the test sheet and

see that it puts down really good
numbers too.
Look at what the chassis we can accomplish with just 475 horsepower.
The GT3 is the absolute best
drivers cars.
The drive makes you realize you never want it to be done.
Well you know like I won't go home to this.
Imagine having the best day or your life with
the most amazing woman you've ever known and then
like you go home in your apartment and there's just nothing.
Whoa we're getting a little darker.
It's kinda like that you get to experience an amazing experience but you know
in the back of your head that it's only for this
fleeting moment.

title: 2015 Porsche 911 GT3: The Ultimate Drivers 911? - Ignition Ep. 121

comments.text:
Unfortunately, the GT3 has become a "numbers car."  Iv'e never driven a GT3 
and probably never will because I live in a very conservative demographic. 
 So, my statement is such...  As an American "motorhead" I hope to see a 
manual transmission option in the future.  Future generations deserve to 
experience a real sports car.  Look!  You can buy a 650hp Z06 Corvette with 
a manual!  Cripes!  Am I really suggesting that Porsche follow Chevrolet's 
lead?  Hell Yeah!﻿

I have watch many of these car reviews by Motor Trend Channel and I have to 
say the guy hosting this episode and many others is the worst car reviewer. 
Not that he is giving the wrong information just the things he says and the 
way he expresses himself. Get a better host. I have only see 1 episode with

comments.author: etobiCRACKscorpions

comments.text:
come on Carlos, people that are interested in the GT3 (that includes me) 
know all the ABC stuff about visibility etc. Can't your reviews be more 
focused and to the essence of the GT3 and its core values. Hows its 
improved over the last gen, how the chassis dynamics have changed compared 
with the last version and how this new engine compares with the old Mezger. 
Potential GT3 buyers, past owners and new to be owners aren't interested in 
the baby stuff, they are generally hardcore petrolheads. I like your 
fluidity in presentation, but could you polish up on your content and 
planning as its kind of so superficial.﻿

comments.author: somos999

comments.text:
I bought a 2003  996 GT3 RS last year, and I love it so. Got it from a 
Porsche dealer with low mileage/full service history, with serious mods to 
both the inlet and exhaust manifolds which give it at the crank 440 HP.
For an extra 4500 pounds I can get gas flowed heads, and larger profile 
exhaust valves, which I've been told give the GT3 an extra 40 horses, but 
at the mo, I'm saving up for colour coded brake calipers/wheels which will 
match the monza red paint finish.

Send in some photo's when it's done.

N.﻿
